Package rover

Class UltraEyes

java.lang.Object
rover.Peripheral
rover.UltraEyes
class UltraEyes
extends Peripheral
The EV3 lego brick can be connected to an ultrasonic sensor, here called UltraEyes (because it looks like a pair of eyes).
Author:
Antoine Stevan

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    (package private) lejos.hardware.sensor.EV3UltrasonicSensor device
    Precision about the Device of a pair of UltraEyes.
    private float[] distance
    Ultrasonic measures are stored inside an array.
    private lejos.robotics.SampleProvider sampler
    To make measures easier a pair of UltraEyes uses a SamplerProvider.

    Fields inherited from class rover.Peripheral

    port

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    UltraEyes​(lejos.hardware.port.Port port)
    One can initialize a pair of UltraEyes by giving it a port.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    (package private) boolean connect()
    Connects an Ultrasonic Sensor to the EV3 lego brick.
    (package private) Measure read()
    Reading from a UltraEyes object means reading the distance to the closest physical object in front of the emitter.
    (package private) void write​(Order order)
    For now, there is nothing to write to a pair of UltraEyes.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • device

      lejos.hardware.sensor.EV3UltrasonicSensor device
      Precision about the Device of a pair of UltraEyes. Here, it is an EV3UltrasonicSensor.

    • sampler

      private lejos.robotics.SampleProvider sampler
      To make measures easier a pair of UltraEyes uses a SamplerProvider.

    • distance

      private float[] distance
      Ultrasonic measures are stored inside an array.

  • Constructor Details

    • UltraEyes

      UltraEyes​(lejos.hardware.port.Port port)
      One can initialize a pair of UltraEyes by giving it a port.
      Parameters:
      port - the port of the pair of UltraEyes, it is basically a SensorPort, from 1 to 4.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      boolean connect()
      Connects an Ultrasonic Sensor to the EV3 lego brick. If any error occurs during the connection, the error is converted into a boolean and returned. During this process, the sensor is enabled by default and everything for easier measures are created for the user.
      Specified by:
      connect in class Peripheral
      Returns:
      true if the peripheral is properly connected to the right port, false if any error occurs.

    • read

      Measure read()
      Reading from a UltraEyes object means reading the distance to the closest physical object in front of the emitter. The value is stored inside a Measure container, as the 'value' field.
      Specified by:
      read in class Peripheral
      Returns:
      a measure given by the connected device, inside a Measure which is a data container.

    • write

      void write​(Order order)
      For now, there is nothing to write to a pair of UltraEyes.
      Specified by:
      write in class Peripheral
      Parameters:
      order - data is sent to a device inside packets of data called Order.
